TypeSignature.Value: public delegate void OlkCommandButtonEvents_MouseDownEventHandler(OlMouseButton Button, OlShiftState Shift, float X, float Y);
.class public auto ansi sealed OlkCommandButtonEvents_MouseDownEventHandler extends System.MulticastDelegate
Public Delegate Sub OlkCommandButtonEvents_MouseDownEventHandler(Button As OlMouseButton, Shift As OlShiftState, X As Single, Y As Single)
public delegate void OlkCommandButtonEvents_MouseDownEventHandler(OlMouseButton Button, OlShiftState Shift, float X, float Y);

Docs.param: An constant that specifies which button on the mouse has been pressed.
A bitwise-OR mask of constants in the enumeration that specifies whether the SHIFT, CTRL, or ALT keys have been pressed.
Identifies the location of the mouse cursor on the X-axis relative to the form.
Identifies the location of the mouse cursor on the Y-axis relative to the form.
Docs.summary: This is a delegate for an event in the corresponding object. After implementing a callback method for the event, use this delegate to connect the callback method to the event. If there are multiple versions of the event interface, this delegate connects the callback method for the event in the specified version of Outlook.
